document_data.name: East Phlan
document_data.mainbody: '''East Phlan''' was the newer region of the [[Phlan]] that formed along the eastern bank of the [[Stojanow River]].{{Cite adventurers league/Reclamation of Phlan|12-13}}{{Cite adventurers league/Reclamation of Phlan|51}}{{Cite dungeon/170/Monument of the Ancients|53}}
document_data.Description: Cobbled streets wound through the area between houses and buildings that leaned against one another.
document_data.History:
The growing community of east Phlan developed over the course of the 15{{th}} century [[DR]], following the reconstruction of the city over decades prior. It formed grew eastward from the city's [[Phlan/Nobles' Quarter|Nobles' Quarter]].{{Cite dungeon/170/Monument of the Ancients|52}}

During the occupation of Phlan by a [[cult of the Dragon]] cell and its [[green dragon]] patron [[Vorgansharax]], during the early 1480'S [[DR]],{{ToD-time}} East Phlan was largely destroyed and overrun by the cult's [[hobgoblin]] and [[orc]] minions.{{Cite adventurers league/Reclamation of Phlan|20-22}}

Notable Locations.Inns & Festhalls: * [[Velvet Doublet]], a festhall that catered to city's affluent nobles, particularly those that preferred more exotic entertainment.{{Cite adventurers league/Reclamation of Phlan|13}}
Notable Locations.Shops & Businesses:
* [[Alero's Smithy]], the shop of the local weapon smith [[Alero]].
* [[Grounds of House Jannarsk]], the estate and mercantile compound of one of Phlan's [[House Jannarsk|noble families]].
* [[Vang's Armory]], an armor smithy operated by [[Brice Vang]].
Notable Locations.Roads: : Axmar Lane • Huldane Way • Lamp Street • The Mezzanine • Oath Street • Steel Avenue
